WorkItem.Description:
I have installed 12.0.30324.00 Update 2 RC and when going to File > New Project, there is no TypeScript node nor any TypeScript related templates to select.

Ignoring that and taking an existing Javascript project and renaming a .JS file to .TS did not show the dialog to enable TypeScript for the project (as seen in Ander's BUILD presentation).
WorkItem.Summary: VS Express 2013 for Web with Update 2 RC does not provide TypeScript new project templates

Comments.Message: We'll need some additional information to figure out what happened here. Did you have a previous version of TypeScript installed? Are there no visible errors of any kind during setup, Visual Studio startup, etc? Have you tried repairing your Visual Studio install?

Closing for now -- please re-open if you can provide the requested information. Thanks!

** Closed by RyanCavanaugh 04/28/2014 10:49AM

Sorry for the long delay in getting back to you.

I did not have a previous version of TypeScript installed, in fact this is installed on a clean install of Windows 8 (upgraded to 8.1).

There are no visible errors of any kind during setup or startup.  I have just now performed a repair on VS Express for Web, but it has not resolved this issue.

I do have the Node.js Tools Beta installed, and I don't recall if I put that on before or after Update 2 RC.
Another update, I've just installed the final Update 2 package overtop of the Update 2 RC, and it has restored the Typescript node as expected.  This is resolved.
Good to hear. Hopefully it was just an RC issue then.
